subject: Sales
title: Positions vs. Interests
description: A 60-second lesson on Positions vs. Interests.

hook.text: Two siblings fight over one orange. Each demands the whole thing. Total deadlock.

buildup.text: A parent asks why. One wants the juice. The other wants the peel for baking. Both can win.

discovery.text: Positions are what people demand. Interests are why. The magic always lives underneath.

twist.text: Most negotiations stall on positions. Nobody pauses to ask the simple question: why do you need that?

climax.text: Dig beneath the demand. When you uncover the real interest, creative solutions multiply fast.

punchline.text: Stop arguing what. Start asking why.

quiz.question: What's the difference between positions and interests?
options: Positions are flexible, interests are rigid
Positions are what you demand, interests are why
